Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2008 12:57AM suzyq18 wrote: hi all, i am due to start rad later this month, are going for mapping on friday hopefully(have a seroma from my masectomy due to ibc at the moment so are not sure if they will be able to do it) i was on chemo for 18 weeks before surgery as my tumour was 8cmx5cm, thankfully all the tumour was removed its only specks that are left, chemo nurse reckons rad is no where near as bad. my tissus is er positive so i am also on tamoxifen am having headaches from it , does anyone else!! I am 45 and am from the uk so treatment might vary a bit here, take care all and good luck with rad will be in touch soon
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2008 10:08AM suzyq18 wrote: hi carriej, thanks for giving me the information, sometimes i cough that much i am sick, then the cough will go away for a couple of days, then i cough no stop again, its more like a tickly cough, on sat i had a pain that went from the front into my back that was very uncomfortable and i felt awfull, am going to oncolgy next thursday so c what he says, when i had a chest xray a few months ago it was all clear, i think somethink is not right thank sue
Posts.Title: Just diagonsed Friday with lung mets CarrieJ LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2008 03:06AM suzyq18 wrote: hi kestrel, i had a masectomy on feb 6th and developed a seroma. i had it drained twice a week 4 five weeks. you do become swollen and very uncomfortable, the colour of the fluid is dark yellow. mine started off at 300mls then slowed down when it got to 60mls they stopped draining. take care
